title: How to Block and Unblock Internet Sites on Firefox

steps.title: Firefox automatically detects your computer’s safety settings.
steps.content: Firefox automatically detects your computer’s safety settings. If you have parental controls or other safety restrictions set up through your computer’s built-in settings, Firefox will detect them and set itself to Prefer:Safe mode. In addition to blocking any websites you’ve added to your computer’s block list, Firefox will activate safety features on each site you visit as long as parental controls are turned on. [1] X Research source There’s no direct way to turn website blocking and other safety features on and off from the Firefox browser.

steps.title: Set up parental controls through Accounts settings in Windows.
steps.content: Set up parental controls through Accounts settings in Windows. To turn on basic parental controls in Windows, you’ll need to set up an account for a child. In Windows 10 or 11, open the Start menu and to go Settings > Accounts > Family & other users . Click Add a family member and follow the prompts to set up an account for your child and add your computer to their account. To manage your parental control settings, go to Settings > Accounts > Family & other users and select Manage family settings online . You can also set up website filtering through the Family Safety App in Windows, but these restrictions only work with the Edge browser. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Note that enabling these filters will completely block all browsers other than Edge, which means your child won’t be able to access Firefox at all!

steps.title: Enable Screen Time restrictions on your Mac.
steps.content: Enable Screen Time restrictions on your Mac. To enable parental controls on your Mac, go to Apple menu > System Settings > [Your Name] and select Family . Click Set Up Family and follow the on-screen instructions to either invite family members or create an account for a child under 13. [3] X Research source Once you’ve done that, you can block or unblock websites in Screen Time .

steps.title: Go to the Block Site installation page.
steps.content: Go to the Block Site installation page . Block Site is a clean site-blocking add-on for your Firefox browser. Alternatively, press Ctrl + Shift + A (PC) or Command + Shift + A (Mac) to open your add-ons manager and search "Block Site." Finally, click the "Recommended" addon to load its installation page. Block Site is one of many extensions you can use to block websites on Firefox. Other popular options include FoxFilter (a parental control addon) and LeechBlock (a productivity addon that blocks time-wasting websites). Some of these extensions are available for the Android version of Firefox. On an iPhone, you can block and unblock websites using Screen Time .

steps.title: Click Add to Firefox.
steps.content: Click Add to Firefox . It's a blue button near the top of the page. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click Add when prompted.
steps.content: Click Add when prompted. You'll see this in the upper-right side of the page. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click Okay.
steps.content: Click Okay . The box will show you where the add-on's icon is so you can use it to block sites. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Visit a website you want to block.
steps.content: Visit a website you want to block. You’ll need to access the website in order to add it to your block list.

steps.title: Click the puzzle piece icon in your menu bar.
steps.content: Click the puzzle piece icon in your menu bar. It’s at the top right side of the Firefox window.

steps.title: Select Block Site and click Run Extension.
steps.content: Select Block Site and click Run Extension . A dialog box will open.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . In the box that opens, you’ll see a message that says “Access to [website] will be restricted with the following rules. Are you sure?” Click OK to confirm. You can adjust the URL in the box if you like. You’ll be redirected to a “Restricted Access” page. You can click Remove Blocking in the lower right corner to remove the block.

steps.title: Visit the Options page for more advanced options.
steps.content: Visit the Options page for more advanced options. To visit the Options page for the app, click the Settings icon next to the Block Site extension after expanding the extensions menu. This will take you to the Options menu. From here, you can: Add or remove websites from your block list. Set a master password for blocking or unblocking sites. Set specific time limits on when certain websites are available or unavailable. Add a redirect URL for blocked sites. Change the way your browser behaves when a site is blocked (for example, you can select whether or not an “(Un)Block this Page” context menu appears on the blocked page). Customize the message that appears when a user tries to visit a restricted website.

steps.title: Install a third-party website filtering app.
steps.content: Install a third-party website filtering app. Since a tech-savvy user can easily disable extensions in Firefox, using separate software can give you an extra layer of control and protection over which websites are accessible on your computer. Some popular options include Qustodio, Kaspersky Safe Kids, and Norton Family. Some of these apps block the use of proxies and other workarounds for accessing blocked websites.

steps.title: Make sure your software supports Firefox.
steps.content: Make sure your software supports Firefox. Many of these apps work with multiple browsers and across multiple platforms (e.g., desktop, iOS, and Android). However, before you make your choice, take a close look at the specs and make sure the software supports web filtering with Firefox. For example, Kaspersky Safe Kids will filter web content in Firefox on desktop, but the mobile version will only work with Chrome (Android only) or the Kaspersky Safe Browser (Android or iOS).

steps.title: Open the HideMe site in Firefox.
steps.content: Open the HideMe site in Firefox. Go to https://hide.me/en/proxy in your browser. This website allows you to route your web traffic through a proxy server, which should allow you to bypass most website blocks. This will only work if whoever controls your network security settings has not blocked access to HideMe. For instance, in many school or work settings, common proxy websites may be blocked. If you can’t access HideMe, try other options such as https://www.croxyproxy.com/ , https://proxyium.com/ , or https://proxypal.net/ .

steps.title: Enter a website's address.
steps.content: Enter a website's address. Type the address of a blocked website into the "Enter web address" text box that's on the right side of the page. You can also select a different country by clicking the "Proxy location" drop-down box and then clicking a new country in the resulting drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Go.
steps.content: Click Go . It's a blue button next to the text box. Doing so will begin loading your website.

steps.title: Browse your site.
steps.content: Browse your site. Once the website loads, you should be able to use it like usual. Keep in mind, however, that your website's load times will likely be significantly slower than usual.

steps.title: Install the Mozilla VPN.
steps.content: Install the Mozilla VPN. If you want a VPN that’s specifically designed to work with Firefox, you can download the Mozilla VPN here. This is a low-cost, subscription-based service that you can use on up to 5 devices. If you’d rather use a different VPN, there are tons of options available, including both free and paid VPNs. Check out our article on how to choose the best VPN . Similar to a proxy, a VPN will route your web traffic through a secure server. This means you may be able to get around website blocks on your network.

steps.title: Open the Mozilla VPN app.
steps.content: Open the Mozilla VPN app. Once you get the app up and running, you don’t have to do anything special in your browser. Simply turn on the VPN and browse the internet as usual. To get started, launch the app once you’ve finished downloading and installing it on your computer or mobile device. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Sign in with your Mozilla account.
steps.content: Sign in with your Mozilla account. If you don’t have a Mozilla account, set one up now. Visit https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/account/ to get started. If you got the VPN through the Apple App Store, you can sign in with your Apple account instead.

steps.title: Select the server you want to use.
steps.content: Select the server you want to use. Click the Select Location dropdown and choose a location. Select the Single-Hop tab and browse through the list of recommended servers, or click All Servers to see more options. Click or tap the server you’d like to use. [8] X Research source By default, the VPN will select a server for you with a strong connection that’s as close to your location as possible. Choosing a server that’s far away (i.e., in another country) may give you access to websites that you couldn’t otherwise visit, but it may also affect your internet speeds.

steps.title: Toggle on the switch to enable the VPN.
steps.content: Toggle on the switch to enable the VPN. If the switch on the main screen is grey and you see text that says “VPN is off,” click or tap the switch to toggle it on. It will turn green ( ) and the text should change to “VPN is on.” [9] X Research source

steps.title: Try visiting a blocked website.
steps.content: Try visiting a blocked website. Once the VPN is active, you may be able to visit websites that are blocked on your network or in your region. This may not work for websites that are blocked on your computer through a Firefox extension, a third-party app, or built-in parental controls. Some network security systems (such as at your work or school) may block your ability to use a VPN while you’re on that network.
